I look in Help-->Update Software-->Managed Configuration and here is the properties report:

I use  java-1.5.0-sun -> java-1.5.0-sun-1.5.0.13 in /usr/lib/jvm
Eclipse-->Window-->Preference-->Installed JRE return:
name of JRE : java-1.5.0-sun-1.5.0.13
Root Directory of JRE :/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.5.0-sun-1.5.0.13

I use Ubuntu gutsy.
~.eclipse/eclipserc contains:
export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.5.0-sun-1.5.0.13/

UnsupportedClassVersionError means your classes were compiled with a java version higher than the vm you are trying to run on.  Generally compiled to 1.5 trying to run on 1.4, or potentially 1.6 trying to run on 1.5.

Double check the compiler settings on your project.  Sending to UI since this is self hosting.
Did you download your development environment from eclipse.org?

> Did you download your development environment from eclipse.org?
